history.content: Call this n8n endpoint with parameters 'email' and 'rootDomain' http://n8n.localhost/webhook-test/fe59eb69-eccf-42f1-90b3-4ffc0c875a5e

This function takes Inputs.Email and Inputs.RootDomain as inputs, constructs a URL with these parameters, and makes a GET request to a specified n8n endpoint. If the request is successful, it sends the response data to the Outputs.ResponseData output and triggers the Outputs.Success signal. If the request fails, it sends the error to the Outputs.error output and triggers the Outputs.Failure signal. It's important to note that the function requires both 'Email' and 'RootDomain' to be provided. If either of these inputs is missing, the function will throw an error.

comments.text:
Set this object with the same properties that you want to work with in your n8n workflow.

For example setting a property 'email' (string) here will be received on the n8n side as ${'Webhook'}.item.json.body.email
Replace the template input properties with whatever you need for the Create New Object node ahead

If you want to get error responses using 'Respond to webhook' nodes in n8n, use 'JSON' response type and create an object with 'code': 500 or any integer that's not 200. 

If this core component detects the 'code' property of the response and it's anything other than 200 or undefined, it'll output the Failed signal and error output

Don't forget to set the root domain of your n8n instance, the webhook id to use for this template copy, and whether this is a test workflow run or not. 

Edit the 'n8n root domain' String node inside the core component to not have to re-type it every time in the template copy.
Clone this component, one for each of your n8n workflows
Add your collection names in here as states, with the exact spelling and capitalisation as your collections in Pocketbase

Make sure you add the following code to your 'Head code' section, in the 'Settings' tab on the left of the editor. 

Replace http://127.0.0.1:8090 with whatever the root domain of your Pocketbase instance is (without the /api part)

Also, if you want a specific Pocketbase version, change @latest to @some-version

<script type="module">
  import PocketBase from 'https://unpkg.com/pocketbase@latest';

  // Initialize and attach to the window object
  window.pb = new PocketBase("http://127.0.0.1:8090");
</script>

Place this 'initial setup' component at the 'App' page of your app. Connect the parent group 'Did mount' to this component's 'Do' input.

This will make sure to check if the User is authenticated and if their auth token is still valid. It will also assign the 'authenticated' value to the 'CurrentUser' object that is globally accessible across your app.
Step 1
Step 2

components.name: /#Global logic components/Pocketbase/Pocketbase - Create or Update Record TEMPLATE

comments.text: Replace someString / someNumber with your own inputs. Make sure the Object node property names exactly match the fields in your Pocketbase table.
Clone this component - one for each of your collections

Set this object with the same properties that you want to work with in your n8n workflow.

For example setting a property 'email' (string) here will be received on the n8n side as ${'Webhook'}.item.json.body.email
Replace the template input properties with whatever 'user' collection fields you want to set, e.g. 'firstName' etc.

If you want to get error responses using 'Respond to webhook' nodes in n8n, use 'JSON' response type and create an object with 'code': 500 or any integer that's not 200. 

If this core component detects the 'code' property of the response and it's anything other than 200 or undefined, it'll output the Failed signal and error output

Don't forget to set the root domain of your n8n instance, the webhook id to use for this template copy, and whether this is a test workflow run or not. 

Edit the 'n8n root domain' String node inside the core component to not have to re-type it every time in the template copy.

1. Follow n8n installation instructions

2. Create a new workflow

3. Copy paste the exact and entire contents of the comment below into the n8n canvas
n8n setup
Copy paste into n8n ⬇️

  // Initialize and attach to the window object
  window.pb = new PocketBase("http://127.0.0.1:8090");
</script>
